body.p: The IASB noted that giving an entity the choice to account for commodity contracts as derivatives would be tantamount to an elective ‘own use’ scope exception, which would have outcomes that would be similar to the accounting treatment in US GAAP. This approach would, in effect, allow an entity to elect the own use scope exception instead of derivative accounting at inception or a later date. Once the entity had elected to apply the scope exception it would not be able to change its election and switch to derivative accounting.
